title: Inflation, Strikes and Cookies
itunes:title: Inflation, Strikes and Cookies
description:
What more should the government do to tackle the inflation crisis? In a week where the Bank of England raised rates to a 13-year high, Bloomberg's Lizzy Burden briefs Caroline Hepker and Stephen Carroll on the challenges facing Andrew Bailey and Rishi Sunak. We examine the current and historical context for the tight spot the UK economy is in with journalist and author Duncan Weldon, and Bloomberg Opinion Columnist Javier Blas. Plus: Data Minister Julia Lopez discusses a new bill which overhauls data protection rules and cookie consent pop-ups. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
